Word: tolãgu "(imper. stemtola-is used alternatively) to move, step aside, get out of the way, go off, be removed, recede, vanish, disappear, terminate, cease, end"
Additional forms: Alsotolãcuto remove

Word: toḍu, toḍ(u)gu, toḍ(u)vu "to put arrow on bow"
Meaning: to touch, (K) be joined, come in contact with
Additional forms: Also (K)toḍukuto hold, grasp; (K)toḍikiluto seize, hold tightly, snatch;toḍaruto follow, acompany; happen, occur; endeavour, attempt; (K also) reach, obtain, hold, copulate with, attack;toḍarikafollowing, accompanying;toḍaruvuendeavour, attempt;toḍusubusiness, affair, connection

Word: dō̃gu "id.; to bathe, sink in water"
Additional forms: Also (K)tō̃cuto sink (tr.), bathe, dip in

Meaning: to flow, gush, run, burst out, fall
Additional forms: Also ?jobbilluto flow, issue, drop, ooze

Meaning: to abandon, quit, renounce; n. separation
to insert, stick in as flowers, cram in, gag by thrusting a cloth in the mouth, caulk (a ship)
Additional forms: Alsotuṭṭecollection, group, heap; (K)tur_umu, (B)turumuto cram or stick, thrust in, deck the head with flowers
Alsotulakimpushining, rejoicing

Meaning: to shake so as to remove dust, etc., shake off, get rid of
Additional forms: Also [1]tolãku, [2]tonãku, [3]toḍãkuto be slightly shaken or agitated as a liquid, be spilled; n. slight agitation or motion in a liquid (or with 3361)

Meaning: the sound made in spitting suddenly
Additional forms: Alsotūpoḍucu(i.e.tū-poḍucu) to spit
Also [1]tūr_ucu, [2]tūrcuto insert, put in, thrust, introduce, push in;dūr_uto enter, penetrate, pierce, force a way, rush in; ? [1]tūrpu, [2]tūrupueast

Meaning: to be scattered as army in battle, be chased, run away
Additional forms: Also (K) [1]tūlcu, [2]tūlucuto chase

Meaning: to be serviceable, useful, suitable, fit, or proper, serve, occur, arise
to tremble, shake, shiver, quake; n. trembling, shaking
to be fit; adj. proper, becoming
Additional forms: Alsouruto be excellent, fit; (K)ūnuto happen, occur; (K) [1]ūncu, [2]ūnucuto make, cause to occur

Alsolōin, inside; inner, internal, inside;lō̃gawithin, in, inside;lō̃gaḍainterior, past time; [1]lō̃gali, [2]lō̃giliinterior of a house, house;lōnuthe inside, heart, mind;lōna, (inscr.)oḷana(7th cent.),ḷōna(9-10th cent.) within, inside, inwardly;lōpalawithin, in, inside; ? [1]lō̃gu, [2]loŋgu, [3]lō̃baḍuto yield, submit, be subdued, retreat;lō̃kuvasubordination, subjection; subordinate, subject to;lō̃cuto subdue; (K)logguto be humbled, subdue
Also (K)uraluto burn (intr.), be ablaze; [1]ummalinta, [2]ummalimpu, [3]ummalikagrief, uneasiness, disquiet

Meaning: rubbing, touch, testing on a touchstone
Additional forms: Alsoora-gallutouchstone;oracuto rub, try by the touchstone;orapurubbing, test by touchstone;orapiḍirubbing, friction;orayuto rub, test by touchstone, touch; be slightly bruised;orayikarubbing, friction;rudduto rub, scour, clean;rudduḍurubbing, scouring, cleaning;rubbuto grind in a mortar;rubbu-guṇḍustone pestle or roller used in grinding things in a mortar; ?ruttuto strike, beat; ?rō̃kalia large wooden pestle

Meaning: to roll, roll down, fall down
sheath, scabbard, case, cover, envelope, ring of baked clay used in the construction of a well, well-tube
to serve as a support, support oneself, stand or be firm; bear, suffer
Additional forms: Alsoūncuto fix firmly;ūṭastrength; [1]ū̃ta, [2]ū̃tamuprop, support;ū̃duto hold, rest or lean upon, support oneself on, place, rest, press, (K also) plant;ūḍucuto transplant; (K)ū̃ṭuto pierce; n. piercing; (VPK)ūcathe supporting stalk out of which grow ears of corn, cholam, etc.; the iron stalk of the sickle, etc., which is fitted into the wooden handle
Alsovaṭincuto starve;baḍugucorpse, a weak creature; lean, thin, slender, skinny
Notes: The formbaḍuguis probably borrowed from Kannada.

Meaning: to prattle, prate, babble, chatter, jabber
Additional forms: Alsovadarũbōtuprattler, babbler; (K)odaruto prattle, prate, abuse

Also (B)varaṭuto pine, become lean or lank;vaṭṭuto be dried up, be drained, become thin or lean; n. (alsovarugu) vegetables or fruit preserved in a dry state; (K also) barren (of cattle), dried; [1]vakku, [2]vagguto become lean, thin, or emaciated, be reduced; [1]vakki, [2]bakkalean, thin
Also [1]vaga, [2]vagapu, (K also)vagalugrief, sorrow, regret;vagadencuto decide, settle, determine;vagadeguto be finally settled or determined

Meaning: to feel a strong desire for anything after long want or privation, long
Additional forms: Also [1]vā̃piri, [2]vā̃pulonging or desiring eagerly after long privation;vēviḷḷu(pl.) longing of a pregnant woman for particular things, with vomiting and other signs of pregnancy

Meaning: to write, inscribe, compose, draw, paint, delineate
Additional forms: Also (K)rāśigerund, having marked (boundaries) (inscr. A.D. 1310);vrā̃tawriting, handwriting;vrā̃takā̃ḍuwriter, clerk;vrāyasamuwriting, letter, note;rāyasamuclerkship;vrāyiletter of the alphabet, writing, line;vrāyincuto cause to be written;vrāluwriting, handwriting;varujuto draw or mark a line with a sharp instrument on a plank, etc.; (K)variyuto test metal on the touchstone

Word: var_uta "in the flood/river (loc. of obl. stemvar_ut-)"
Additional forms: Alsovar_r_uflow, flood

Meaning: to efface (the writing in inscriptions), destroy (a grant)

Word: vancu "to serve from a container, empty"

Meaning: to search, explore, rummage, examine, scrutinize, seek or search for, look for
Additional forms: Also [1]vedakulāḍu, [2]vetakulā̃ḍuto search;vedakuḍusearching, search
Alsovinukalihearing; [1]vinucu, [2]vinipincuto cause to hear; [1]viniki, [2]vinki, [3]vinikiḍihearing, listening, audience, hearsay;vīnuthe ear; celebrity
Alsobelayu'to spread', (K also) 'to increase'
Notes: The form withb-probably borrowed from Kannada.

Word: pulli vistari "a leaf on which one has eaten food"
Meaning: platter of leaves sewn together for taking food on
